title: CTRL0000928882 - Transcribed Interview of Anton Lunyk, (October 6, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 3:39 p.m.
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
So we will go on the record at 3:39 p.m. eastern time.
This is a deposition of Mr. Anton Lunyk conducted by the House Select Committee
to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House
Can you please state your name, Mr. Lunyk, and spell your last name for the
This deposition is being conducted remotely.
This will be a staff-led deposition, though members
Joining me from the select committee, we have Mr.
And from the members, we have Mr. Pete Aguilar
We will be following the House deposition rules that we provided to your counsel
Under the House deposition rules, you are permitted to have an attorney present,
but counsel for other persons or government agencies may not attend.
the only lawyers present are those from the select committee and your counsel.
At this time, I'd ask Mr. Lunyk's counsel to please state their name
Mathew J. Mari, M-a-r-i, 30 Wall Street, New York, New York for Mr.
Under House deposition rules, neither committee members nor staff may discuss
the substance of testimony you provide today unless the committee approves release.
You and your attorney will have the opportunity to review the transcript afterwards.
I'm going to go through a few ground rules for this deposition for you very quickly
and then we'll give Mr. Mari a chance to put his remarks on the record.
There's an official reporter transcribing the conversation.
final official recording of this proceeding.
The deposition's also being recorded, but the reporter's transcription is the
Mr. Lunyk, can you confirm that you're not recording this, please?
Please wait until each question is completed before you begin to respond, and we
will do our best to wait until your response is complete and then we'll start our next
The reporter cannot note nonverbal responses such as shaking your head.
see you shaking your head, I'll annotate it for the record, but please do your best to
the answer, please just say so and I'll do my best to rephrase it.
We ask that you give complete answers to the best of your
If a question is unclear, please ask for a clarification.
Logistically, please let us know if you need any breaks or if you'd like to talk with
You can turn your cameras and mic off and you can talk to Mr. Mari.
We'll just go off the record.
Throughout the deposition, we'll be directing your attention to exhibits.
share our screen and show those exhibits so you can see them on the screen.
have any questions or if you can't see the exhibits, please just let us know and we'll try to
either zoom in or figure out a way where you can see the exhibit clearly.
M r . - You may refuse to answer a question only to preserve a privilege
privilege, we may either proceed with the deposition or we can seek a ruling from the
If you refuse to answer a question based on a
If the chairman overrules such an objection, then you are required to answer each
My goal today is to ask questions relevant to the select
committee's investigation with the hope that you will answer.
or privilege assertion, we'll ask that you assert it on the record.
Ultimately, the more detail you provide today about any objections, the better
that way we can understand the objection on the record.
You are here pursuant to a
This exhibit has been marked as exhibit No. 1
In terms of this investigation, Mr. Lunyk, the select committee is separate and
independent from the Department of Justice.
prosecutions, and the DOJ is not a partner with the select committee in this investigation,
but I also want to remind you as we do for all witnesses, not just you, but every witness, it
is unlawful to deliberately provide false information to Congress.
We have no involvement with the
And providing false information could result in criminal penalties, including under
Do you understand that you cannot deliberately provide false information to
M r . - And do you have any questions about the information I've
So since this is a deposition, it's under oath, would you please
stand and raise your right hand to be sworn in.
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
Mr. Mari, I believe you have some remarks you'd like to put on
Just very briefly as an outline.
D.C. on January 6th intending to participate in what was billed as a rally.
was inside the building someplace where he should not have been.
The protest turned into a riot, and before you know it, Mr. Lunyk
for which he pied guilty to.
He was brought to court, Federal Court in
His court-appointed attorney explained the charges to him.
His lawyer advised him to plead guilty to the charges
Mr. Lunyk understands that he broke the law that day and accepted his
He's been sentenced by the court.
In his mind, he thought everything
was over, but once this story began about the call from the White House, Mr. Lunyk's life
Since that time, he's been under extreme pressure to the point where his job is in
jeopardy, to the point where he feels his safety may be in question, to the point where he
has conferred with me about maybe changing his name and moving from his address.
All in all, we've discussed this very thoroughly and I've advised him to volunteer to
come before this committee to clear the air and to tell his story.
Basically, the problem here is that if a call was made from the White House to his
phone, he has no knowledge of anyone he knows working in the White House.
no knowledge of having received the call.
information, but this is the information that he has.
He's not questioning whether it was made or
That's beyond him, but unfortunately, it would be better if he had more
He has requested T-Mobile to provide him with his telephone records for the time
make sure that the committee gets those records as soon as possible.
When he does receive them, I will
We look forward to the production of the
And just like what you said, Mr. Mari, that's all we're looking for as well is just for Mr.
Lunyk to answer the questions we have here today about the phone call and some of the
other events from January 6th as well.
Appreciate you all going out and getting those pursuant to the subpoena.
And all we can ask is that you give us answers to the best of your recollection like
we went over during the ground rules.
So we'll start with some background, Mr. Lunyk.
How long have you lived in Brooklyn?
Five years at undergraduate college, Brooklyn College.
I live in Brooklyn, New York.
And what do you currently do for a living?
I am a New York State licensed public adjuster.
How long have you been doing adjustment work?
Now, Mr. Mari just covered this briefly in his opening.
You have already pied guilty for your conduct on January 6th back in
And you were sentenced last month in September?
I think you're breaking up a bit.
make sure we have it clear for the record.
You're currently serving the home confinement portion of your
Just walk us through when you
left -- I'm assuming you left New York to come to D.C.
Walk us through that time period before the rally on the 6th?
did you leave New York, when did you arrive in D.C., and what was your plan?
We left the night before, traveled overnight, got to D.C. early, and then
proceeded to the Ellipse when the event was starting.
So you left, let's say, approximately the night of January 5th into the
And you left with Mr. Francis Connor and Mr. Antonio Ferrigno.
Was it on a train, via automobile?
Was it your car you all drove?
how you pronounce the last name?
And approximately what time did you arrive in Washington, D.C. on
Do you remember what time the rally at the Ellipse was supposed to start or
what time you got there, at least?
I don't recall, maybe 8, 9, something along those
So you got there when the rally at the Ellipse was starting?
I got there a little bit earlier.
So at this time of the day, like the morning of January 6th, what was your
We parked the car and then proceeded to the
plan for the day other than going to the rally at the Ellipse?
Going to see the President speak and support him and then go home.
So at this point, the plan was not to go to the Capitol?
We had no idea or intention to go to the Capitol, neither did we know that
that was even going to be a part of that day's events.
When did you become aware that the Capitol would be a part of the day's
After President Trump got the warning that our time at the Ellipse has come
to an end and they're going to be setting up another stage behind the Capitol where
Can you say that last part one more time just to make sure we have it?
You're breaking up a little on our end.
Mr. Mari, that was our official reporter.
Can you just restate it again about when you became aware of the Capitol?
Towards the end of President Trump's speech, they let him
know that we cannot continue at the Ellipse and that there was another stage being set
up behind the Capitol for them to continue speaking.
So someone let President Trump know this?
We -- all we were told via mic, I don't remember who
grabbed the mic and spoke it, but they said that we cannot continue this event at the
set up for us to speak.
We are going to continue on behind the Capitol where another stage is being
That's all I know on the matter.
Was this someone in the crowd who told you this or someone up on the
I believe President Trump himself announced that; that they were going to
be continuing at that stage behind the Capitol.
So you became aware of the Capitol when President Trump
himself said it during his speech?
And you went to the Capitol because President Trump said so during his
We wanted to continue and see the end of the speech and see who
else would be speaking and gather any possible information that, you know, they were
We went through the filings in your criminal case, of course.
there was one from -- it looks like it's an lnstagram message possibly from the night of the
5th into the morning of the 6th where you say -- and this is in quote:
call as he's about to start eating dinner.
troops and patrolled the streets of D.C. into the next morning clearing out Freedom Plaza
He didn't even touch his food, gathered the
I'm assuming this Tarrio refers to Enrique Tarrio.
Do you know who Enrique Tarrio is?
Was that at the time the leader or president of the Proud Boys?
To your knowledge, are any of your friends or anybody that you were there
I guess are you a member of the Proud Boys?
Were you ever a member of the Proud Boys?
in D.C. with members of the Proud Boys?
To be honest, I didn't know much about that group.
What did you know about the group the Proud Boys, at that time?
them around that time and around those times through a social media app.
remember if it was Parler or Parlay or something along those lines.
President Trump's Twitter, then we got word that he would be going over to Parler or
Parlay -- again, don't know the pronunciation of the app name -- and that's really about it.
A lot of videos were published on that app and other things were posted on that
app that provided us with information and what not, and that's really about it.
And there was one other message I just wanted to ask about as well where
you told a friend, You're going to be my "in" to the Proud Boys.
So were you just -- help us understand that.
Did you ever attempt to become a
I believe it was just in the heat of the moment and all the events that
A lot of things were taken out of context, especially the text
messages with me and my friends from our lnstagram chat.
If anything, that's more of our, quote/unquote, "darker humor" that's meant to be
taken more like a skit in a sense that, you know, we joke around between each other, but
there was no serious intent behind any of those messages whatsoever.
So you got to the Ellipse, and then you went to the Capitol, but I guess big
picture, when you came to D.C. on January 6th, were you expecting that there would be
Was this your first time in Washington, D.C., too?
We attended another rally a few months prior to that, and we were
just overwhelmed with love and compassion by all the other attendees.
loved it so much that when we found out that President Trump would actually be
speaking at the follow-up rally on January 6th, you know, we all kind of decided that we
are going to go and we are going to see him speak in public, live, and that's really that.
So we were going to touch on this a little later.
from a couple months before, was that a November 14th rally in Washington, D.C.?
And that's the one where President Trump drove by?
It was at the Freedom Plaza.
Had a convoy and that's it.
He did a lap around the
Freedom Plaza and went on his way.
Do you mind if I actually grab my cell phone charger?
Did you go to the rally in December in D.C.
I think the only one we went to was the November one at the
And so, as you just said, just make sure I capture it correctly, you were
motivated to come back in January because President Trump was going to be speaking?
We saw some of the pictures in the filings for your criminal case.
like you were in the VIP area.
Were you in the VIP area during the rally at the Ellipse?
At the Ellipse, we weren't in the VIP area.
We were on the railing that
divided the VIPs versus the general public.
You were inside the security parameter, though, is that fair?
Well, we went through security that day.
through went through metal detectors, everyone was searched, and then we just
happened to be a few of the early people that were there early enough to get to the front
for all the regular public attendees, not politicians, not celebrities, not speakers.
So you were at the front of almost like the general admission part
What speakers other than President Trump were you most excited
Well, we didn't know that there was going to be -- or at least I didn't know
that there was going to be multiple speakers.
President Trump speak live, but when his son came out, that was, you know, exciting.
When Rudy Giuliani spoke, that was great, and that's really about it for me.
I just strictly was focused on seeing
And you said this earlier, but just to make sure we captured it as well.
recalled during President Trump's speech, him saying that you were going to go down to
We were going to go down to the Capitol
to continue the speeches, because we were not done.
out of time at the Ellipse.
Was it your impression that President Trump would be walking to the
We ran out of time, or they ran
That was not my impression at all.
they would let him at the time to walk publicly amongst all the other people for security
Do you recall President Trump saying anything about Vice President Pence
I remember he touched briefly upon something, but I do not remember the
context of what he touched upon.
Do you recall if it was about, you know, Vice President Pence certifying the
That sounds familiar, that he was out at
the Capitol, they were in their meeting room or whatever it was.
specifics and don't remember them, but that's basically what it was.
I guess what type of impression did that leave on you when President Trump
was talking about Vice President Pence during his speech?
Can you elaborate on the question?
Like, did you feel any animosity or any type of way towards Vice
Were you disappointed in him at that time?
At the time, I can imagine all of his supporters were that were there.
you know, in a sense, yeah, there was some degree of disappointment, but none that
would lead to violence or me wanting to, you know, lead some type of rebellion against it.
That was not my intention there.
What was the general mood of the crowd that was around you during
President Trump's speech at the Ellipse?
It was a great atmosphere to my remembrance of the event.
So do you remember approximately what time you left the Ellipse to start
I don't remember specific time frames, but I want to say maybe
mid-afternoon or early afternoon, something along those lines.
Did you walk directly from the Ellipse straight to the Capitol, or did
you make any stops in between?
We went back to my car to freshen up, drink some water, warm up a
little bit because it was very cold that day.
then they said, oh, they're continuing the speeches at the Capitol.
And then when we just saw crowds and
We, you know, kind of stopped and asked what was going on and
So when you started walking towards the Capitol, you were under
the impression that there were speeches going on at the Capitol?
And were the people around you were under that impression from what you
From what I can tell, yes.
It was a little bit of a hike to get there, so
close enough to be able to see what was going on.
Nobody knew what we had installed for us when we actually got
So when did you become aware, then, that there was violence happening at
the Capitol, because I know you got -- I know you entered the Capitol at 3:08 p.m., so
that's about an hour after it had been breached initially.
aware that there was violence going on at the Capitol?
When we got to -- I don't know if this was the front facing part of the Capitol,
but when we got to where everyone was waving the flags and those big steps, that's
when we kind of got an idea.
remember -- I don't know if it was a pepper bomb or some type of pepper spray device
that, you know, we started smelling and we thought, listen, maybe we probably shouldn't
be in this particular area right here and that's when we kind of departed left, went up the
stairs around the building, and then through the crowd.
We didn't see anything firsthand at the time, but I do
That was how we entered the
So it appears -- and I know this from the filings in your criminal case -- you
arrived on the West side of the Capitol where the inauguration stage was set up.
Do you remember like a big stage?
Did you walk down the National Mall or did you walk down a street to get
We walked down streets to get there, I believe.
And then you said you went off to the left when there was the
pepper spray or the pepper bomb, and that's towards the left like the scaffold steps.
And by this point when you're going up the steps, you're starting to
And you said that you all -- I'm assuming -- it was just the three of you all.
The three of you -- you said something, like, to the effect of you realized you
Well, we continued because we didn't know what was left in store for the
tried to get away from it, but just to turn around and walk out, the amount of incoming
people that was still coming, you know, it was either be trampled and try to get out of
there, or wait it out until it dies down a bit in the area and then depart.
You know, we did see the violence, so we kind of continued through the crowd and
So when we wrapped around that scaffold in part, we got to a part where there
That's where we entered through, and it wasn't as violent around
It was just people walking in and out, and we just kind of
Everybody was just chanting "USA" walking in.
should be continuing and follow the crowd.
When I walked in, I didn't see any
So, right away, felt a little more, in a sense, safe, not for only us, but for
So that's when we kind of felt, listen, this is the way that we
And we're going to get into -- in a second.
your 10 minutes inside the Capitol shortly, but was anyone instructing you how to get
Nobody was instructing us how to get in, but when we entered, I do
specifically remember there was maybe eight or nine officers to the left that basically no
one was able to surpass them.
And one of them with his hand directed and said, that's the way that people are headed.
So we didn't really question it or look too much into it.
Nobody was able to walk towards the left-hand side.
We just followed the crowd to
And I think we'll see those officers when we pull up the video,
and that's actually a good segue.
I was just wondering, you mentioned hearing chanting of the USA.
Were there other chants that you heard as you were walking up towards the Capitol?
You don't remember any chants about Trump specifically?
Stop the Steal I might've heard, but it wasn't anything that caught on to a
It was just a few people yelling.
This is going to be surveillance footage and it's at approximately 3:08 p.m. when
you entered the Capitol, and we're going to go to the 3-minute-and-33-second time
So let's -- we'll play this for a little bit.
I want to make sure you can ID yourself.
I believe you're going to come through this middle door with the exit sign above it.
I believe that's where you and your two colleagues entered the Capitol.
we'll play this for about 10 seconds.
I believe that's you with the gray hoodie over the red Make America Great
So that shows you going into the Capitol at 3:08 p.m. through the Senate wing
We can take this exhibit down.
door, so that's on the West side of the Capitol, and it looks like you're heading towards
So making that right, because you said the officers were off to your left.
So I believe this shot is just 4 minutes later at 3:12 and we're going to go to the
Can we pull up exhibit 11, please?
2-minute-and-55-second time stamp, and I believe this is where you all are walking down
the hallway of the House wing door.
And I'm just doing this, Mr. Lunyk, so you
understand, so we can have accurate time stamps of where you are throughout the day
before we get to the phone calls.
And then, I believe you took a picture in the crypt as well, took a
picture with the three people you were with.
We asked somebody to take a photo, yeah.
And that was in your criminal filings as well.
And then at exhibit 12, we'll pull this up.
It's at 3:18 p.m., this is when you leave
And we'll go to the 4-minute-and-40-second time stamp.
to be a little tougher to see, but I believe you're going to see you, and looks like right here
with the gray hoodie on the top left part of the screen fighting through the crowd to go
So we're accurately identifying that you left the Capitol now at 3:18
Where did you go after you left the Capitol?
Straight to my car and straight to get out of there.
Approximately, how long did it take you -- I know this is going to be a tough
After leaving the Capitol, did you ever go back
approximation, but approximately how long did it take you to walk, you know, through
that West plaza to get free and clear to get to your car?
I would say maybe 15, 20 minutes just to get through the crowd and actually
get to my car and freshen up, change, warm-up a little bit, and then depart.
If you had to guess, what time were you in the car driving back to New York?
We stopped for gas not too far away, and then we
just hit the highway back to New York.
So you all went in the Capitol, walked straight back to the car like you said,
freshened up a bit, got warm, and then hit the road back to New York immediately?
And it looks like from your criminal filings, there was a picture of
your license plate back in New York by about 8:28 p.m., so about 8:30.
Mr. Lunyk, just in case we ever needed to confirm this, do you
remember if you paid for that gas with a credit card or cash?
To be honest, I don't recall.
After you left the Capitol as you were walking to your car, did you meet up
Did you go to the White House or anything like that?
You stayed with the same two colleagues of yours and then went straight to
So I want to confirm, is your phone numbe
So we're going to go through a few phone calls.
On January 6th of 2021 that was your phone
We talked to your attorney about this back in June, but we want to ask
So can we pull up exhibit 3 -- exhibit 8, I'm sorry.
And we're going to go down to
the bottom of page 3 of exhibit 8, and you're going to have to probably scroll in on this.
I'm sorry that the font is a little small.
So these are the phone records that we received, all right.
military time, which is 4:34 p.m. in the afternoon.
You can see there's a 9-second call.
It's really, you take away 5 hours, 16:34
And can you scroll to the right a little bit?
number for the White House switchboard.
That 202 number is the area code for Washington, D.C.
Do you recall receiving a call from the White House on January 6th?
Did you know at the time anyone who was working in the White House in
Do you know anyone ever that has worked in the White House, particularly,
At that time, I didn't and still to this day, I don't.
Did you know any spouses or have any friends that had spouses or family
that worked in the White House at that time?
Do you recall picking up a number from an unidentified number that you
might have known on January 6th as you were going back to New York?
At 4:34, since you said you left probably around 4, I'm assuming you were on
the road at that point out of the city?
Do you know anyone in the Trump family, Mr. Lunyk?
Do you know anyone in the Giuliani family?
So you don't know Andrew Giuliani either?
Do you have any friends or colleagues that know anyone in the Trump
I guess what's your reaction to hearing back in June and then seeing this
phone record of the White House switchboard calling you on January 6th?
Back in June when I was first informed about it from my court?
Like, back in June when you were first informed and then now
as you see the record, like what's your -- just tell us, like, what's your reaction to this?
I brushed it off, to be honest, because when my lawyer told me that CNN is
calling him and telling him that a phone call was placed to my phone, I laughed and said,
you know, I don't want to hear anything more about this, because why would the White
House be calling me out of all people?
I'm a nobody in this situation.
I'm irrelevant, and I told them to drop it.
then he let me know a few other times beyond that point that, you know, they keep
calling, they want you to do a statement, and then we got to this point.
Have you ever been involved in politics in your life, like, formally or
No, just kind of got, I guess, into it just on social media and with friends, but
I've never been involved in any politics formally, no.
You ever worked on a campaign before?
Never worked for, you know, a local politician or a Congressman or anything
You've only followed politics, as you said, on social media?
the Giuliani family ever called you directly?
What's the whole thing with Andrew Giuliani?
That's been brought up a few times now.
Oh, we're just asking questions and you're answering them.
Just for the record, has Andrew Giuliani or any member of
Does anybody else, any other staff or Mr. Aguilar have any follow-up questions
So right after this call at 21:34, which is really 16:34, there's a call at 16:37, so 4:37
Can we scroll back over to the far left side of this exhibit?
p.m. So just minutes afterwards, and it's about 25 minutes, a little under 25 minutes long
Do you know -- and we talked to Mr. Mari about this earlier -- do you know whose
It's a lady that's affiliated with my office.
contents inventories for all of our claims.
Do you recall what you were calling this individual about shortly after the
So this is a work-related number for someone you work with?
Well, I had her on social media at the time, and she saw a post of mine that I
posted for a few minutes and then took down, but she was one of the few people that
saw it in that time frame.
don't remember if I called her or she called me.
And then when she saw what was happening on the news, I
She was just asking me what was going
And then we just spoke to her and then other phone calls came in.
Do you have a last name?
And can you spell the Gigi for me?
To my knowledge, it's just G-i-g-i.
That's what I have her saved in my
And it's incoming, so she called you.
And what was the name of the company that you all worked with
I work for Rubin & Rosen Adjusters.
her in and source out our jobs to her whenever we need inventories put together.
So it seems like this woman, Ms. Gigi, called you because she saw what was
going on on your social media and she was calling you to talk about what had just
It does, but like I said, I don't know if that was her legal last name at the time
That is not -- I only know her by Gigi.
So you don't know Saleem Zherka?
That was the last name that she went by,
but, again, she never -- we never discussed legally if that was her last name or not, so I
name was, so I just always referred to her as Gigi.
I didn't know if Gigi was a nickname.
I didn't know what her actual first
Does that trigger any follow-up from any staff or Mr. Aguilar?
So her name might be Gigi Zherka.
We can take this exhibit down.
Is that fair for us to
I wanted to talk about, Mr. Lunyk, when you talked about, you
know, being there and the mood of the individuals, and that in a positive light, did you
notice -- can you talk a little bit about getting into and getting through security?
notice -- what was your experience with the magnetometers?
or backpacks outside of the event?
Not bags or backpacks, no, but when President Trump announced
that we were going to be wrapping up at the Ellipse, you know, we were at the front of
the line and we decided let's shoot out first just in case, you know, we were going to head
down there and whatnot, got to the car warmed up a little bit, kept going, and when we
got there, we noticed that there was already a bunch of people there and majority of the
people at the front of, you know, everything that was happening were all wearing tactical
gear, head to toe to the point where you couldn't even recognize some of their skin
So that I found a little odd where, you know, it was just announced that we were
going to, you know, walk over there and whatnot.
15 minutes later, there's already a crowd in the front dressed in tactical gear, and nobody
knows who these people are, where they came from, why they were already there, you
know, probably before President Trump announced that we were going to continue at
That's the only thing that I found odd, but no, no bags, no nothing like that.
So did you feel that they were prepared for -- to go on the walk
because they were already in tactical gear?
The individuals that you referenced that are head to toe tactical
gear, you found it odd that they were there.
prepared that they knew that they were going to be on the front lines of something?
Was it almost that they were kind of
Definitely seems possible, and they did resemble a lot
of the characters that were antagonizing us at the original rally at the Freedom Plaza a
few months before where families and elderly folk were getting attacked by members of
an organization that I recall to be antifa.
Not saying that there's any connection there, but that was
So the individuals on the 6th that showed up with tactical gear, is it
your belief they may have been planted there; that they may have not been Trump
I mean, it's definitely a thought that crossed my mind, but is it a
When you entered -- so flash back a couple hours on your way in,
did you notice anything unique at the magnetometers, or upon entry going through,
going through the security to get in to hear the President?
M r . - Oh, no problem at all.
Can I just follow up really quickly?
want to go back quickly to the 9-second call.
phone ringing, you looking at it?
I work w i t h - .
